strings


collection of functions to handle strings
naming convention:
- string is a regular C string, char array terminated by null
- bstr is a string block, char array + length
- ctsr works like a C string, in memory is preceded by a header storing the length, capacity of a char array


C_CHAR_NULL

#define C_CHAR_NULL 0
type: C preprocessor definition

C_ENDLINE

#define C_ENDLINE   '\n'
type: C preprocessor definition

bstr_init

#define bstr_init(text) { sizeof(text) - 1, text }
type: C preprocessor definition
description: block string initialization

c_ascii_numerical

bool c_ascii_numerical(char c);
type: C function
description: test if character is between 0 and 9

c_ascii_alphabetical

bool c_ascii_alphabetical(char c);
type: C function
description: test if character is in the alphabet (no accents TODO)

c_ascii_alphabetical_lower

bool c_ascii_alphabetical_lower(char c);
type: C function
description: test if character is between a-z

c_ascii_alphabetical_upper

bool c_ascii_alphabetical_upper(char c);
type: C function
description: test if character is between A-Z

c_ascii_special

bool c_ascii_special(char c);
type: C function
description: test if character is a special characters

c_atoi

int    c_atoi(const char *text);
type: C function
description: ascii to integer

c_atof

double c_atof(const char *text);
type: C function
description: ascii to double

c_string_equal

bool c_string_equal(const char *a, const char *b);
type: C function
description: test if two c strings are equal

type: C function
description: test if string a is superior to b

c_string_inferior

bool c_string_inferior(const char *a, const char *b);
type: C function
description: test if string a is inferior than b

type: C function
description: return character index in string

type: C function
description: return character index in string from index

type: C function
description: return index of first character of ToFind if found in string

description: returns character at index position, 0 if index invalid

uint c_string_length(const char *text);
type: C function

bstr

typedef struct {
  size_t length;
  char  *characters;
} bstr;
type: C struct
description: block string, designed to speed up text functions when length is already known

gc_bstr_null

extern const bstr gc_bstr_null;
type: C variable
description: global null bstr

c_string_sub

bstr c_string_sub(const char *text, uint start, size_t count);
type: C function
description: return sub-part of string

c_string_sub_from

bstr c_string_sub_from(const char *text, uint start);
type: C function
description: return sub-part from start index

type: C function
description: split string with split_char

description: initialize string block with string

str_header

typedef struct {
  size_t length;
  size_t capacity;
} str_header;
type: C struct
description: header for cstr type, saves the current length and capacity of the string

cstr

typedef char *cstr;
type: C typedef
description: cstr - C string pointer preceded by header
memory layout: str_header | data | terminator (0)

c_cstr_to_bstr

bstr   c_cstr_to_bstr(const cstr str);
type: C function
description: get string block from cstr

description: return length of cstr

cstr c_cstr_grow2(cstr str, size_t n);
type: C function
description: doubles the size of cstr until n can be added
